attributes.action: Call for the Government to drop and cap the energy prices and scrap the “Daily Standing Charge”
attributes.additional_details:
In time of recession when we don't have enough money, the energy companies increased the gas and electricity prices even though they make billions in profit.

Centrica for example made £1.3 billions profit in the first 6 months of 2011 ONLY, yet they put the prices up for gas by 18% and electricity by 16%.

EDF had profits of £7.5 billions in the first 6 months, but the electricity increased by 4.5% to which added a 14.70p "Daily Standing Charge"; and gas by 15.4% to which added a 23.10p "Daily Standing Charge".

The increase in energy prices means many people, specially the elderly and disabled won't be able to afford to keep warm this winter.

I call for the Government to step in, drop and cap the energy prices at an affordable level.

I call for the Government to scrap the "Daily Standing Charges" for both electricity and gas.

Since the energy companies just increased the prices by 10%-15%, a 30% drop and cap won't do them any harm, and they will still make a profit.
